pullRequest.body:
Definition of the homogeneous lexicographic order

This is part of an ongoing work on basic of GrÃ¶bner theory.
A subsequent PR will add the homogeneous reverse lexicographic order.

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</summary>

`+ instance : OrderedCancelAddCommMonoid (DegLex (Î± â†’â‚€ â„•))`

`+ ofDegLex`

`+ single_lt_iff`
`+ single_strictAnti`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19453~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
I have only very minor suggestions, otherwise it looks good to me.
Then, you may define `DegLex.linearOrder` directly, and remove `DegLex.partialOrder`.

I had guessed that it could be interesting â€” for mathlib's eventual future applications â€”Â to define all intermediate structures that depend on less assumptions, but that's indeed irrelevant to the one I have in mind.
In any case, I removed the definition of the partial order.

It seems only these three fields are necessary:
```suggestion
  le_total := DegLex.linearOrder.le_total
  decidableLE := DegLex.linearOrder.decidableLE
  compare_eq_compareOfLessAndEq := DegLex.linearOrder.compare_eq_compareOfLessAndEq
```

```suggestion
  simp only [gt_iff_lt, DegLex.lt_iff, ofDegLex_toDegLex, degree_add,
    degree_single, Nat.reduceAdd, lt_self_iff_false, true_and, false_or]
```
@joelriou what do you think of this?

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Finsupp/MonomialOrder/DegLex): homogeneous lexicographic order
